title: 114_hr6248
content: The "Spending Safeguard Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes a spending limitation on direct spending programs. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes a spending limitation for direct spending programs, determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget within 90 days of enactment. The limitation is set at 120% for certain programs and 110% for others based on program costs. The Spending Safeguard Act sets spending limitations for direct spending programs, with costs determined by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. The cost of the program is based on a six-year estimate using scorecards or estimates under the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010. The Director maintains a spending safeguard limitation scorecard for each program, and the Treasury Secretary reports monthly spending amounts for programs listed on the scorecard. The Spending Safeguard Act establishes spending limits for direct spending programs, with costs determined by the Office of Management and Budget Director. The Director maintains a spending safeguard limitation scorecard for each program, and the Treasury Secretary reports monthly spending amounts for programs listed on the scorecard. Additionally, reports on total spending levels for these programs are submitted to the House and Senate Budget Committees biannually and included in the President's budget submissions. The Spending Safeguard Act sets spending limits for direct spending programs, with the Director determining costs. If a program is nearing its spending limit, a report is sent to the Budget Committees and relevant jurisdictional committees. The Spending Safeguard Act imposes spending limits on direct spending programs. If a program reaches its limit, funds cannot be obligated, and a report must be submitted to relevant committees. Federal agencies must inform program participants about the spending limitation. Definitions include the Director of the Office of Management and Budget and the meaning of direct spending. The term "Director" refers to the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. Direct spending is defined as per the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. A direct spending program is a Federal program funded by direct spending without a specific authorization of appropriations in statute. No additional funds are authorized for this Act.
